result.execSummary:
The defendant Ameer R McFarland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ameer R McFarland is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ameer R McFarland was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (17 pages) commencing 06/17/2015 received and filed.  CH

Defendant Ameer R McFarland in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Defendant Ameer R McFarland in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 2: Motion to dismiss by the defense, argued and GRANTED by the Court. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armour. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.     Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

Attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski in court, defendant Ameer R McFarland not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 7.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 06-16-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski in court, defendant Ameer R McFarland not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Per ADA Stingl he this case can be calendered outside of his scheduled court week.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 7.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 06-15-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ameer R McFarland in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Defendant Ameer R McFarland in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court found that the defendant waived his speedy trial when he requested new counsel.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 6.11.15 and for jury trial on 6.22.15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 06-11-2015 at 08:30 am.

  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for 06-02-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ameer R McFarland in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Ameer R McFarland in custody.  Ron Dague for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ameer R McFarland in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Ameer R McFarland in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
